data.title: Peak Perspective: Mountain West Conference 2024 All Sports Season Champion.
data.meta_description: Our annual review of the conference sports calendar.
data.text:
The end of May signals the end of the Mountain West Conference sports season. Although the baseball and softball MW champions may still be playing in the NCAA tournaments, the Mountain West has crowned champions for all of its sports at this point in the year. Before fall sports start back up with official practices in August, now is as good a time as any to review each sport by listing the regular season and conference champions.

Last year, San Diego State was crowned our 2023 all-sports champion for the Mountain West. This year, every sport was able to have a champion, and some sports featured repeat winners or remarkable runs in their respective sport. More on that below.

The scoring isn’t a perfect science, and keep in mind it’s all for fun. Don’t get bent out of shape if the team you don’t like scores higher than the team you do like. But if you have an idea for different scoring, feel free to share. We are a blog site doing blog site things, and that involves making up a weighted point system to crown a hypothetical all-sport champion. If it’s not your thing, it’s cool if you move on to the next post.

(All champions are based on listed info from Mountain West official site)

Scoring

Not trying to offend any sports, but some should carry more weight than others. The Mountain West sponsors 19 sports. Each sport will be split into three tiers. Football, men’s and women’s basketball, baseball, and softball will all be worth 3 points. The second level will consist of volleyball, and women’s soccer, accounting for two points. The rest will all be worth one point. For sports that have regular season and conference tourney champs, each will get full points and each will count as a separate championship. Same with ties.

Champions

Men’s Cross Country:

New Mexico (tournament) 1

Women’s Cross Country:

Colorado State (tournament) 1

Women’s Soccer:

San Diego State (regular season) 2

Utah State (tournament) 2

Women’s Volleyball:

Utah State (regular season) 2

Fresno State (tournament) 2

Football:

Boise State (conference championship game) 3

Women’s Swimming and Diving:

San Diego State (tournament) 1

Men’s Indoor Track and Field:

Colorado State (tournament) 1

Women’s Indoor Track and Field:

Colorado State (tournament) 1

Women’s Basketball:

UNLV (regular season) 3

UNLV (tournament) 3

Men’s Basketball:

Utah State (regular season) 3

New Mexico (tournament) 3

Women’s Gymnastics:

Boise State (tournament) 1

Women’s Golf:

San Jose State (tournament) 1

Men’s Golf:

San Diego State (tournament) 1

Men’s Tennis:

Boise State/Utah State (regular season) 1

Boise State (tournament) 1

Women’s Tennis:

New Mexico (regular season) 1

San Diego State (tournament) 1

Men’s Outdoor Track and Field:

Air Force (tournament) 1

Women’s Outdoor Track and Field:

Colorado State (tournament) 1

Softball:

San Diego State (regular season) 3

San Diego State (tournament) 3

Baseball:

Air Force (regular season) 3

Fresno State (tournament) 3

Totals:

(number of championships in parentheses)

San Diego State: 11 (6)

Utah State: 8 (4)

Boise State: 6 (4)

UNLV: 6 (2)

New Mexico: 5 (3)

Fresno State: 5 (2)

Colorado State: 4 (4)

Air Force: 4 (2)

San Jose State: 1 (1)

Hawaii: 0 (0)

Nevada: 0 (0)

Wyoming: 0 (0)

Notes

Three teams did not have a championship in any sport this season. Although it’s the hardest for Hawaii, as they are only eligible for one sport.

The repeating champs would be Swimming & Diving (SDSU), Women’s Indoor Track and Field (Colorado State), Women’s Basketball (UNLV), Men’s Golf (SDSU), and Men’s (Air Force) and Women’s (Colorado State) Outdoor T&F,

It was a tighter race this, with over half the conference winning multiple championships and five teams taking home at least three. Although Utah State gave them a run for their money, it was once again San Diego State who led the way for the Mountain West. The Aztecs took home the most championships and the most points in this scoring. Winning the softball regular season and conference tournament gave them over half of their points, but they also won championships in women’s soccer, women’s swimming and diving, men’s golf, and women’s tennis.

Congrats to the Aztecs, who are the 2024 all-sport champions!
